subsection_analysis.refined_text: You can choose to either select the users to assign or create product profiles and assign users to the profiles. You can manage the deployment of Acrobat AI Assistant through the Adobe Admin Console. For more information, see Packaging apps via the Admin Console

You can export a PDF to PostScript for printing and prepress applications. You can also create an EPS file from any PDF for placement or opening in other applications. The PostScript file includes full DSC (Document Structuring Conventions) comments and other advanced information preserved by Adobe Acrobat Distiller

Create the appearance of a certificate-based signature You determine the look of your certificate-based signature by selecting options in the Signatures panel of the Preferences dialog box

You can create PDFs from documents printed on paper, Microsoft Word documents, InDesign® files, digital images, and more. Diﬀerent types of sources have diﬀerent tools available for PDF conversion. In many applications, you can create PDFs by selecting the Adobe PDF printer in the Print dialog box

For example, you can drag files to the Acrobat icon to create PDFs.. Every PDF balances eﬃciency (small file size) and quality (such as resolution and color). If the balance between the file size and the quality is critical to your task, you must use an appropriate conversion method

Acrobat and Acrobat Reader support XML data signatures that are used to sign data in XML Forms Architectures (XFA) forms. The form author provides XML signing, validating, or clearing instructions for form events, such as button click, file save, or submit. Like PDF digital signatures, XML digital signatures ensure integrity, authentication, and non-repudiation in documents.
